com.esri.mo2.data.gcd
Interface Geocoder

All Known Implementing Classes:
IMSGeocoder
public interface Geocoder

Defines an interface for geocoding addresses.

Invariant:
TRUE

Method Detail

describeGeocoder

public PropertySequence describeGeocoder()
                                  throws GeocoderException
Returns a PropertySequence instance describing geocoder.

Returns:
The returned PropertySequence should have at least the following fields:
Name - locator's name;
Description - general description of the locator as seen in the description field of the authoring dialog, e.g. "US Streets with Zone (File-based)".
ReferenceData - (for the moment) full filename (with an absolute path) of the shape file this geocoder is using.
FieldAliases - an array of Strings containing input field name aliases that can be used in a UI dialog. A user should refer to the document describing a particular implementation of the Geocoder interface to learn about extra properties that the returned PropertySequence might have.
Throws:
GeocoderException
Precondition:
TRUE
Postcondition:
result.getValue("Name")!=null && result.getValue("Description")!=null && result.getValue("ReferenceData")!=null && result.getValue("FieldAliases")!=null

dispose

public void dispose()
Cleans up system resources that would not be cleaned automatically. This method SHOULD be called on a geocoder instance right before the last reference to this instance is severed. In particular, this method should be called right before quitting an application using a geocoder.

Precondition:
TRUE
Postcondition:
TRUE

findAddressCandidates

public MemoryFeatureClass findAddressCandidates(Row address,
                                                PropertySequence propMods)
                                         throws GeocoderException
Generates candidates for an address (represented in the normal or standardized form)

Parameters:
address - the address, represented as com.esri.mo2.data.feat.Row, for which alternative geographic positions with match score (or candidates) will be located. Fields of address should be those returned by either getAddressFields, getStandardizedFields, or getStandardizedIntersectionFields methods of the same interface. In case an input address is missing a value for a certain field, the row representing this address should contain null or an empty string "" in the corresponding column.
propMods - the property set which holds properties of the geocoder (e.g. spelling sensitivity) that the user wants to override temporarily. The parameter propMods can be empty (have no properties) or null if no overrides are necessary. propMods can only have the property names as returned by getLocatorProperties of Geocoder.
Returns:
an object of com.esri.mo2.map.mem.MemoryFeatureClass which contains one record per each address candidate. Candidates are listed in the decreasing order according to the match score they received during matching. The fields of the MemoryFeatureClass object are those returned by getCandidateFields or getIntersectionCandidateFields methods of the Geocoder interface depending on the fields of the input address.
Throws:
GeocoderException - if an error has occured while trying to find address candidates.
Precondition:
 address != null &&
 (  address.getFields() <==> this.getAddressFields() ||
    address.getFields() <==> this.getStandardizedFields() ||
    address.getFields() <==> this.getStandardizedIntersectionFields()
 ) &&
 props.getNames() <==> this.getLocatorProperties.getNames()
Postcondition:
 (
    ( address.getFields() <==> this.getAddressFields() ||
      address.getFields() <==> this.getStandardizedFields()
    ) ==>
      result.getFields() <==> this.getCandidateFields()
 ) &&
 (
    ( address.getFields() <==> this.getStandardizedIntersectionFields()
    ) ==>
      result.getFields() <==> this.getIntersectionCandidateFields()
 )

geocodeAddress

public Feature geocodeAddress(Row address,
                              PropertySequence propMods)
                       throws GeocoderException
Geocodes a single address (represented in a normal or standardized form).

Parameters:
address - the input address, represented as com.esri.mo2.data.feat.Row, for which geographic position will be found. Fields of the address should be those returned by the getAddressFields method of the Geocoder interface (e.g. ADDRESS and ZIP, in the case of the "US Streets with Zone" style), values are the actual address values (e.g. "380 New York St", "92373"). In case an input address is missing a value for a certain field, the row representing this address should contain null in the corresponding column.
propMods - the property set which holds properties of the geocoder (e.g. spelling sensitivity) that the user wants to override temporarily. propMods can be empty (no properties) or null if no overrides are necessary. If non-empty, propMods can only have the property names as returned by getLocatorProperties of Geocoder.
Returns:
an object of the com.esri.mo2.data.feat.Feature type containing the resulting address. Fields of the returned Feature object are those returned by getResultFields method of the Geocoder interface. If address is not found, null is returned. Note that the resulting feature has a geometry element represented as a com.esri.mo2.ext.gcd.GcdPoint which is an instance of com.esri.arcgis.client.params.SpatialReference associated with it.
Throws:
GeocoderException - - if an error has occurred while geocoding the address.
Precondition:
 address != null &&
 (address.getFields() <==> this.getAddressFields() ||
 address.getFields() <==> this.getStandardizedFields() ||
 address.getFields() <==> this.getStandardizedIntersectionFields()) &&
 props.getNames() <==> this.getLocatorProperties.getNames()
Postcondition:
 result == null ||
 ((result != null) && (result.getFields() <==> this.getResultFields()))

geocodeAddresses

public MemoryFeatureClass geocodeAddresses(Table addressTable,
                                           PropertySequence addressFieldMapping,
                                           PropertySequence propMods)
                                    throws GeocoderException
Geocodes a table of addresses.

Parameters:
addressTable - contains one address per record.
addressFieldMapping - holds a correspondence table between the field names expected by the geocoder (as returned by getAddressFields) and the field names from the incoming addressTable. This arrangement permits addressTable to have field names that are different from those specified by getAddressFields. Property names of addressFieldMapping are the field names returned by the getAddressFields method (e.g. Street and ZIP), values are the corresponding field names in the input addressTable. If a field in addressTable directly corresponds to the one expected by the geocoder, no mapping property in addressFieldMapping has to be given. Accordingly, the mapping property for this field can be missing or the value of this property can be null or an empty string.
propMods - the property set which holds properties of the geocoder (e.g. spelling sensitivity) that the user wants to override temporarily. propMods can be empty (no properties) or null if no overrides are necessary. If non-empty, propMods can only have the property names as returned by getLocatorProperties of Geocoder.
Returns:
an object of type com.esri.mo2.map.mem.MemoryFeatureClass whose every feature corresponds to one row of addressTable. If geocoding fails for some address specified by a row in the addressTable, the feature returned for this address has a geometry Point(0,0) (this is a temporary workaround, geometry should be just null). Success of the geocoding operation for a particular address can be determined based on the content of the field Status: "M" for matched, "U" for unmatched, "T" for tie. The fields of the resulting MemoryFeatureClass are those returned by getResultFields plus ResultID field, which relates each result to the original address (via an ObjectID)
Throws:
GeocoderException
Precondition:
 addressTable != null &&
 addressTable.getFields() <==> this.getAddressFields() &&
 (
    addressFieldMapping == null ||
    addressFieldMapping != null &&
      ( ForAll i : 0 <= i < addressFieldMapping.getCount() |
          addressTable.getFields().findField(this.getAddressFields().getNames()[i])==-1 ==>
            ( this.getAddressFields().findField(addressFieldMapping.getNames()[i])!=-1 &&
              addressTable.getFields().findField((String) addressFieldMapping.getValues()[i])!=-1
            )
      )
 )&&
 props.getNames() <==> this.getLocatorProperties.getNames()
Postcondition:
 (ForAll i : 0 <= i < result.getFields().getNumFields() |
    result.getFields().findField(this.getResultFields().getNames()[i])!=-1 &&
    result.getFields().findField("ObjectID")!=-1)

getAddressFields

public Fields getAddressFields()
                        throws GeocoderException
Returns fields that geocoder needs to geocode address.

Returns:
a collection of fields that the input Row/Table should have for the geocoding operations geocodeAddress, geocodeAddresses, findAddressCandidates to succeed.
Throws:
GeocoderException
Precondition:
TRUE
Postcondition:
result != null

getCandidateFields

public Fields getCandidateFields(PropertySequence propMods)
                          throws GeocoderException
Returns fields contained in an address candidate.

Parameters:
propMods - the same as in geocodeAddress above.
Returns:
a collection of fields that will be returned by findAddressCandidates when given an non-intersection address.
Throws:
GeocoderException
Precondition:
TRUE
Postcondition:
result!=null

getDefaultInputFieldMapping

public PropertySequence getDefaultInputFieldMapping()
                                             throws GeocoderException
Returns recognized names for all input fields

Returns:
a property sequence in which property names are the field names returned by getAddressFields and values contain a comma-delimited list of common field names for this field (e.g. the "Street" property might contain a list like "addr, street_addr, address"). A user interface can use this list to automatically determine the fields containing the address information in the input row/table passed to the geocoding methods of this interface.
Throws:
GeocoderException
Precondition:
TRUE
Postcondition:
ForAll i : 0 <= i < result.getCount() | this.getAddressFields().findField(result.getNames()[i])!=-1

getIntersectionCandidateFields

public Fields getIntersectionCandidateFields()
                                      throws GeocoderException
Returns fields contained in an intersection candidate.

Returns:
a collection of fields.
Throws:
GeocoderException
Precondition:
TRUE
Postcondition:
result != null

getLocatorProperties

public PropertySequence getLocatorProperties()
Returns default properties of a locator

Returns:
property sequence containing names and default values of the geocoder properties, which are used while executing a geocoding function (such as geocodeAddress) when not overridden by a property value given in the propMods argument.
Precondition:
TRUE
Postcondition:
result != null

getResultFields

public Fields getResultFields(PropertySequence propMods)
                       throws GeocoderException
Returns fields resulting from the geocodeAddress operation.

Parameters:
propMods - same as in geocodeAddress
Returns:
a collection of fields returned by the geocodeAddress operation.
Throws:
GeocoderException
Precondition:
propMods == null ||
propMods != null && (ForAll i : 0 <= i < propMods.getCount() | this.getLocatorProperties().findProperty(propMods.getNames()[i])!=-1)
Postcondition:
result.getFields().findField("#SHAPE#")!=-1

getStandardizedFields

public Fields getStandardizedFields()
                             throws GeocoderException
Returns fields contained in a standardized address.

Returns:
a collection of the fields (instances of com.esri.mo2.ext.gcd.AddressField) in a standardized address, each one represents a different part of the address, e.g. the street name, or the house number. This fields are returned in a row representing a standardized address by standardizeAddress method.
Throws:
GeocoderException
Precondition:
TRUE
Postcondition:
result!=null

getStandardizedIntersectionFields

public Fields getStandardizedIntersectionFields()
                                         throws GeocoderException
Returns fields contained in a standardized intersection address. This method is only available if the service supports intersections.

Returns:
a collection of fields (instances of com.esri.mo2.ext.gcd.AddressField) that are returned in a row representing a standardized intersection address by standardizeAddress method.
Throws:
GeocoderException
Precondition:
TRUE
Postcondition:
(gcd.getLocatorProperties().findProperty("IntersectionConnectors")!=-1) ==> result!=null

standardizeAddress

public Row standardizeAddress(Row address,
                              PropertySequence propMods)
                       throws GeocoderException
Standardizes an address.

Parameters:
address - is Row in which fields are returned from the getAddressFields function (e.g. street and ZIP), and values are the actual address values (e.g. 380 New York St, 92373). To pass an empty value for a certain element in the row (e.g. in a case when there is no ZIP code), one can assign to the corresponding value an empty string or null.
propMods - the same as in geocodeAddress above.
Returns:
a row containing the submitted address in the standardized form.
Throws:
GeocoderException
Precondition:
address.getFields()<==>this.getAddressFields()
Postcondition:
the result row has the fields returned by the getStandardizedFields or getStandardizedIntersectionFields, plus an additional field, Addr_type. The value of Addr_type is either "A" or "I" indicating whether result is an ordinary or intersection addresses. Other values are the standardized components of the submitted address. Namely, 
 result.getFields().findField("Addr_type")!=-1 &&
 (
   (
     (result.getValue(result.getFields().findField("Addr_type"))<==>"A") ==>
     ForAll i: 0 <= i < this.getStandardizedFields().getNumFields() | result.getFields().findField(this.getStandardizedFields().getField(i))!=-1
   ) &&
   (
     (result.getValue(result.getFields().findField("Addr_type"))<==>"I") ==>
     ForAll i: 0 <= i < this.getStandardizedIntersectionFields().getNumFields() | result.getFields().findField(this.getStandardizedIntersectionFields().getField(i))!=-1
   )
 )
